ygData.subject: Re: ImportError: No module named ctml_writer, OS X
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello, I have a similar issue with no module named ctml_writer on my iBook 10.4.11.  Here is the error I receive in Matlab (7.4): Traceback (most recent call

Hello,

I have a similar issue with no module named ctml_writer on my iBook=
 10.4.11.  Here is the 
error I receive in Matlab (7.4):

Traceback (most r=
ecent call last):
   File "./.cttmp1200348228.pyw", line 1, in ?
     from =
ctml_writer import *
 ImportError: No module named ctml_writer
 
??? 

****=
********************************************
                Cantera Error!=
                  
************************************************


Proce=
dure: get_XML_File
Error:   cannot open ./gri30.xml for reading.Note, this =
error indicates a possible 
configuration problem.

Error in =3D=3D> XML_No=
de.XML_Node at 11
   x.id =3D ctmethods(10,15,0,src); % newxml(name)

Error=
 in =3D=3D> Solution.Solution at 30
doc =3D XML_Node('doc',src);

Error in =
=3D=3D> IdealGasMix at 39
       s =3D Solution(a);

Error in =3D=3D> equil=
 at 12
   gas =3D IdealGasMix('gri30.cti');


I insured that the python ver=
sion I installed (MacPython 2.5 under Current) is listed in the 
PATH befor=
e the pre-installed version.  Here is my PATH:

/Applications/Cantera/bin:/=
Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/Current/bin:
/usr/local/bin:/u=
sr/local/graphviz-
2.14/bin:/Applications:/usr/local:/Applications/MATLAB74=
/bin:/bin:/sbin:/usr/bin:/usr/s
bin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/texbin

These PATH =
statements are in /etc/profile.  I have run the setup_cantera script and tr=
ied 
reinstalling cantera to no avail.  I previously had a working version =
in Matlab, but recently 
needed to upgrade my computer so I'm reinstalling.=
  I followed the instructions at http://blue.caltech.edu/~dgg/html/cantera-=
build.html.   I tried running python with 
adiabatic_flame.py and it worked=
 as expected.  I've also verified that I have 
/Applications/Cantera and th=
e Matlab toolbox folder in the Matlab path through "Set 
Path..."

I would =
appreciate any help that you can offer.  Thanks in advance.

Rusty

--- In =
cantera@yahoogroups.com, Dave Goodwin <dgoodwin@...> wrote:
>
> It looks to=
 me like you have more than one Python installation. Be  
> sure to run the=
 script setup_cantera to set environment variable  
> PYTHON_CMD to the Pyt=
hon interpreter used to install Cantera. If you  
> installed a version of =
Python yourself, but the system Python  
> intrpreter in /usr/bin comes fir=
st in PATH, this sort of problem will  
> occur.
> 
>

t 10:12 AM, Winston Burbank wrote:
